programmes.show_description: Tracks - Part Two: Darren is found not guilty after an emotionally-charged testimony where he makes a personal confession, but Connor still believes that something is amiss.
Your daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection.
Shopping from home.
The Second Time Around: Classic British sitcom. The departure of Banks leaves a void in the lives of Simon and Mrs Sadler, but could Mrs Sadler still have a chance of happiness?
The Cistern: Enduring British sitcom following the capers of bus driver Stan at home and at work. Stan and Arthur decide to splash out on a new loo.
Ross admits the truth to Marlon about Shane's behaviour toward Donna, and the pair plot revenge against the shady officer.
Shane delivers a threat to Eli, who proceeds to team up with Marlon to teach him a lesson. Chas is riled by Shadrach's delight at seeing pictures of a youthful Gennie.
Carla finishes with Tony on Liam's wedding day and dresses to kill in a bid to upstage the bride, but a tearful Maria confesses she can't go through with the nuptials.
Maria struggles to come to a decision about marrying Liam, and Alex causes a scene when he crashes the wedding, claiming he wants to meet his family
A Minority of One: Feature-length drama. Frost finds his patience pushed to the limit when faced with the death of a police informer on an estate that is riven by racial tension.
Only Make Believe: An unwanted guest lands Wetherby in hot water, and Oscar and Ventress embark on a top-secret private detective case but find that their cover story is in danger.
The Devil Rides Out: Rumours are quick to spread when a local church is vandalised, Lord Ashfordly's godson rolls into town, and David shows Peggy that he can make a bob or two.
Death's Shadow: The inhabitants of a sleepy village are shocked when a local property developer who was recently diagnosed with a malignant brain tumour is brutally murdered.
A nervous Ross agrees to lure Shane into a trap set by Eli and Marlon. Lexi seeks to impress Carl by drumming up more business, Val tells Diane the Woolpack needs a new look.
Donna is furious when she uncovers Ross and Marlon's scheme to knock Shane down a peg or two. Lexi gains inside information about Carl and Donald's plan to rebrand their company.
Michelle is in turmoil over how to deal with Alex, who walks into the Rovers to patch things up with her. Roy decides to visit Hayley in Africa.
A dejected Alex goes missing after meeting Michelle and is later escorted back to the pub by a police officer. Jack discovers he's won 3000 pounds on the horses.
Changing Roles: Rachel takes a key witness to a murder trial into protection in Aidensfield - and tries to keep him safe long enough to testify - and Joe bumps into an old flame.
A Brush with the Law: The local hunt arrives in Aidensfield, Lord Ashfordly comes under suspicion of arson when old rivalries surface.
Out of the Woods: Comedy-drama series. When PC Mylow goes to the woods with Al for his stag weekend, it quickly goes horribly wrong and park ranger Stewart and Martin must find them.
Erotomania: Comedy-drama series. Disastrous consequences occur when Martin urges the village chemist to remove her neck collar, and Danny has a surprise in store for Louisa.
Colours: A murder at an Army base threatens long-held secrets amongst a regiment, and a protest at a hair salon exposes growing racial tensions in Oxford.
Siren: Crime drama. Connor and the team investigate an audacious murder where an ambulance is run off the road and its patient is shot in the head.
First Aid: '70s sitcom following the capers of bus driver Stan at home and at work. Inspector Blake demands that all bus crews pass a first aid test or be suspended.
Your daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection.
Shopping from home.
The Remorseful Day: Last-ever episode. The year-long investigation into the murder of Yvonne Harrison in a quiet Cotswold village is revitalised with the promise of new evidence.
Wycliffe: The Cycle of Death: Pilot episode of the crime drama. A bookshop owner in Penzance is brutally murdered, and Wycliffe discovers all is not well in the family.  Ep1
The Blue Geranium: Did a woman really die of shock when the geranium in her wallpaper turned blue, and can Miss Marple stop a trial before the wrong person is found guilty of murder?
Sweet Angelica: Light-hearted drama series about a couple of amateur sleuths. Rosemary and Laura are not convinced by police theories when two bodies are found at a language school.
A Simple Plot: Light-hearted drama series about two amateur sleuths. Rosemary and Laura get caught up in dangerous high finance dealings when an elderly blind man is found dead.
A Tale of Two Hamlets: The death of a young film star at a Satanic experience at his family's ancestral pile brings Barnaby and Troy to the feuding hamlets of Upper and Lower Warden.
Birds of Prey: When Julian Shepherd is found drowned it seems as though he died of suicide but Barnaby suspects foul play.
The Green Man: Murder mystery drama. An accident during the restoration of a canal leads to a particularly complex case for Barnaby and Troy involving a group of rowdy teenagers.
Bad Tidings: Murder mystery drama. Sergeant Dan Scott arrives to work with Barnaby - and is thrown straight into a murder investigation in Midsomer Mallow.
The Blanket Mire: Detective drama. When the body of a missing teenager is discovered buried on the moors, Vera is forced to delve into the life and the secrets of the victim.
The Day of the Devil: Morse and Lewis find themselves in a terrifying world of devil worship as they hunt for a violent rapist who has gone on the run from prison.
